curated_text: Symbol: FIS. Year: 2024. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: FIS, Worldpay, IPO, ELA, Company, TSA, the Worldpay Sale, Unaudited, RealNet, Worldpay Group plc, Guarantees, Virtus Partners, Virtus, Banking to Corporate, Capital Banking Market Corporate Solutions Solutions, 571 Total, Software, 533 Total, Professional, 410 Total, Contract Balances The Company, the Remaining Performance Obligations As, Consolidated Financial Statement Details Cash, Property and Equipment, Property, Net Intangible, Capital Corporate Banking Market And Solutions Solutions Other Total Balance, Banking and, Capital Markets, Weighted Average Interest Interest, Rates Rate, the Revolving Credit Facility, Secured Overnight Financing Rate, Weighted Average Interest, Rate Maturities, the Revolving Credit Facility's, USCP, the Restated Credit Agreement, the Senior GBP Notes, AOCI, Net Investment Hedges, Euro-, Pound Sterling, Euro, Cross-Currency Interest Rate Swap Designations, Contingencies Securities, Fidelity National Information Services, Inc. Securities Litigation, Inc., Georgia Code §, City of Southfield Fire and Police Retirement System, Young Family Living Trust, the “Southfield Demand, the “Young Demand, Board, Demand Review Committee, McCollum, Hialeah Demands, the Young Demand, The Demand Review Committee, City of Hialeah Employees’ Retirement System, the Hialeah Action, the Individual Defendants, the McCollum Demand, the McCollum Action, Brazilian Tax Authorities Claims In, Fidelity National Servicos de Tratamento de Documentos, Fidelity National Participacoes Ltda, the Transpev Group, Transpev/Prosegur, Board of Directors, Segment Information, Capital Market Solutions, Corporate, Future Forward, FASB ASC Topic, Indirect Worldpay, Diluted, FIS 1.25, Trade, Contents FIDELITY NATIONAL INFORMATION SERVICES, INC., Purchases, Treasury, Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Fidelity National Information Services, Inc., Consolidated Financial Statements, COVID-19. Context excerpt: competition covenants, distribution mechanics, preemptive rights and follow-on equity funding commitments of the Buyer, and restrictions on transfer and associated tag-along and drag-along rights. Each of FIS and the Buyer will have the right to require Worldpay to consummate an initial public offering ("IPO") or sale transaction after the fourth anniversary of the closing, subject to certain return hurdles and (in the case of an IPO) public float requirements, which requirements will fall away following the sixth anniversary of the closing. We have continuing involvement with Worldpay, primarily through our remaining interest, an employee leasing agreement ("ELA"), a transition services agreement ("TSA"), and various other commercial agreements. Under the terms of the ELA, which was substantially completed by July 1, 2024, the Company leased certain employees to Worldpay in the United States, China, Colombia and South Korea.
